alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 2:24PM EDT until June 22 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CHARLES...CENTRAL STAFFORD...KING GEORGE AND EASTERN SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 223 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms with a history of producing damaging winds were located along a line extending from near Nanjemoy Creek to near Potomac Creek to Fredericksburg, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause considerable damage to trees. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are likely. Unsecured light objects will become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Stafford, Fredericksburg, King George, Fairview Beach, Potomac Creek, Aquia Creek, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Falmouth, Passapatanzy, Stones Corner, Weedonville, Ironsides, Snell, Ramoth, Thornburg, White Oak, Sealston, Jersey and Berthaville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
